# CTFriend-JOHNLOVECOFEE
First, we got weird strings from the challenge
<pre></pre>
These strings have three words. And if we look carefully at the strings we will find out that in the strings don't have 'LOVELOVE'. It just has single 'LOVE'. So I figured it out this is morsecode use 'LOVE' for '/'.</br>
  - JOHN: '-'
  - LOVE: '/'
  - COFFEE: '.'

I coded python to convert the strings to morsecode and decode morsecode to plaintext.</br>
<pre>┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/CTFriends-JOHNLOVECOFEE]
└─$ python3 solve.py               
CTFr{too_much_caffeine_can_cause_high_blood_pressure}</pre>
